Name: Almaty
Description: Former capital and largest city of Kazakhstan, known for its scenic surroundings and vibrant cultural scene.

Name: Astana (Nur-Sultan)
Description: The capital city of Kazakhstan, known for its modern architecture and political significance.

Name: Shymkent
Description: The third-largest city in Kazakhstan, known for its historical sites and proximity to the Uzbekistan border.

Name: Karaganda
Description: A large industrial city located in central Kazakhstan, known for its coal mining and heavy industry.

Name: Aktobe
Description: An important city in western Kazakhstan, known for its oil and gas industry.

Name: Pavlodar
Description: Located in northeastern Kazakhstan, Pavlodar is an industrial hub for metallurgy and power generation.

Name: Ust-Kamenogorsk
Description: A city in eastern Kazakhstan, known for its metallurgy industry and proximity to the Russian border.

Name: Semey
Description: A historic city in eastern Kazakhstan, known for its cultural heritage and role in Soviet-era nuclear testing.

Name: Kyzylorda
Description: A city in southern Kazakhstan, known for its agricultural significance and proximity to the Aral Sea.

Name: Atyrau
Description: A city in western Kazakhstan, known for its oil industry and access to the Caspian Sea.
